ReverseProxy.description: Reverse proxy configuration for routes and clusters.

Routes.description: Named routes that direct incoming requests to clusters.

ClusterId.description: Name of the cluster this route points to.

Order.description: Order value for this route. Routes with lower numbers take precedence over higher numbers.

MaxRequestBodySize.description: An optional override for how large request bodies can be in bytes.

AuthorizationPolicy.description: Specifies which authorization policy applies, e.g. 'Default' or 'Anonymous'.

RateLimiterPolicy.description: The name of the RateLimiterPolicy to apply to this route.

OutputCachePolicy.description: The name of the OutputCachePolicy to apply to this route.

Timeout.description: The Timeout to apply to this route. This overrides any system defaults. Setting both Timeout and TimeoutPolicy is an error. Format: 'hh:mm:ss'.

TimeoutPolicy.description: Specifies which timeout policy applies, e.g. 'Default' or 'Disable'. Setting both Timeout and TimeoutPolicy is an error.

CorsPolicy.description: Specifies which CORS policy applies, e.g. 'Default' or 'Disable'.

Path.description: Path pattern using ASP.NET route template syntax, e.g. '/something/{**remainder}'.

Hosts.description: Only match requests with the given Host header. Supports wildcards and ports. For unicode host names, do not use punycode.

Values.description: Matches against any of these values.

Mode.description: How the header values should be matched.

QueryParameters.description: List of query string match conditions.

Values.description: Matches against any of these values.

Mode.description: How the query parameter values should be matched.

Metadata.description: Arbitrary key-value pairs for custom route logic.

Transforms.description: List of transform objects for request customization.

anyOf.$comment: Fallback that matches any custom user-defined transforms.

anyOf.description: Sets whether incoming request headers are copied to the outbound request.

RequestHeadersCopy.description: If true, copies all request headers to outbound request.

anyOf.description: Specifies if the incoming request Host header should be copied to the proxy request.

RequestHeaderOriginalHost.description: If true, preserve the original Host header; otherwise the destination's host is used.

anyOf.description: Transform for setting, appending, or removing a request header.

RequestHeader.description: The header name to operate on.

Set.description: Value to set the given request header to.

Append.description: Value to append to the given request header.

anyOf.description: Transform that removes a specified prefix from the request path.

PathRemovePrefix.description: Prefix to remove from the existing request path.

anyOf.description: Transform that replaces the entire request path with the provided value.

PathSet.description: Sets the request path to this value.

anyOf.description: Transform that adds the specified prefix to the request path.
Transform that adds or replaces a query string parameter with a value from the route configuration.

QueryRouteParameter.description: Specifies the query parameter name to add or replace.

Set.description: Name of the route paramter to set the query parameter to.

Append.description: Name of the route paramter to append to the query parameter.

anyOf.description: Transform that replaces the entire request path using a pattern template, replacing {} segments with the route value.

PathPattern.description: A path template starting with a '/', e.g. '/my/{plugin}/api/{**remainder}'.

anyOf.description: Adds or replaces parameters in the request query string.

QueryValueParameter.description: Name of a query string parameter.

Set.description: Value to set the given query parameter to.

Append.description: Value to append to the given query parameter.

anyOf.description: Removes the specified parameter from the request query string.

QueryRemoveParameter.description: Name of a query string parameter.

anyOf.description: Changes the http method used in the request.
Adds or replaces a header with a value from the route configuration.

RequestHeaderRouteValue.description: The header name to operate on.

Set.description: Route value to set the given header to.

Append.description: Route value to append to the given header.

anyOf.description: Removes the specified header from the request.
YARP copies most request headers to the proxy request by default, this transform disables RequestHeadersCopy and only copies the given headers.

RequestHeadersAllowed.description: A semicolon separated list of allowed header names.

anyOf.description: Adds headers with information about the original client request.

X-Forwarded.description: Default action to apply to all X-Forwarded-* headers.

For.description: Action to apply to the 'For' header.

Proto.description: Action to apply to the 'Proto' header.

Host.description: Action to apply to the 'Host' header.

Prefix.description: Action to apply to the 'Prefix' header.

anyOf.description: Adds a header with information about the original client request.

Forwarded.description: A comma separated list containing any of these values: 'for,by,proto,host'.

ForFormat.description: Format to apply to the 'For' header.

ByFormat.description: Format to apply to the 'For' header.

Action.description: Action to apply to the 'Forwarded' header.

anyOf.description: Forwards the client cert used on the inbound connection as a header to the destination.

ClientCert.description: The header name to use for the forwarded client cert.

anyOf.description: Transform controlling whether response headers are copied from the original response.

ResponseHeadersCopy.description: If true, copies all response headers from the destination back to the client.

anyOf.description: Transform for setting, appending, or removing a response header.

ResponseHeader.description: The header name to operate on.

Set.description: Value to set the given response header to.

Append.description: Value to append to the given response header.

When.description: Specifies if the response header should be included for all, successful, or failure responses. Any response with a status code less than 400 is considered a success.

anyOf.description: Removes the specified header from the response.

When.description: Specifies if the response header should be included for all, successful, or failure responses. Any response with a status code less than 400 is considered a success.

anyOf.description: YARP copies most response headers to the proxy response by default, this transform disables ResponseHeadersCopy and only copies the given headers.

ResponseHeadersAllowed.description: A semicolon separated list of allowed header names.

anyOf.description: Transform controlling whether trailing response headers are copied from the original response.

ResponseTrailersCopy.description: If true, copies all trailing response headers from the destination back to the client.

anyOf.description: Transform for setting, appending, or removing a response trailer.

ResponseTrailer.description: The trailer name to operate on.

Set.description: Value to set the given response trailer to.

Append.description: Value to append to the given response trailer.

When.description: Specifies if the response trailer should be included for all, successful, or failure responses. Any response with a status code less than 400 is considered a success.

anyOf.description: Removes the specified trailer from the response.

When.description: Specifies if the response trailer should be removed for all, successful, or failure responses. Any response with a status code less than 400 is considered a success.

anyOf.description: YARP copies most response trailers to the proxy response by default, this transform disables ResponseTrailersCopy and only copies the given headers.

ResponseTrailersAllowed.description: A semicolon separated list of allowed trailer names.

Destinations.description: Named destinations where traffic is forwarded.

Health.description: Optional override URL accepting active health check probes.

Host.description: Optional fallback host header value used if a host is not already specified by request transforms.

Metadata.description: Arbitrary key-value pairs for custom destination logic.

SessionAffinity.description: Session affinity is a mechanism to bind (affinitize) a causally related request sequence to the destination that handled the first request when the load is balanced among several destinations.

Policy.description: Determines how the session will be stored and retrieved.

FailurePolicy.description: Strategy for handling a missing destination for an affinitized request.

AffinityKeyName.description: Identifies the name of the field where the affinity value is stored (cookie or header name).

Domain.description: Specifies the domain of the cookie.

Path.description: Specifies the path of the cookie.

Expiration.description: Specifies the expiration of the cookie. Format: 'hh:mm:ss'.

MaxAge.description: Specifies the maximum age of the cookie. Format: 'hh:mm:ss'.

SecurePolicy.description: Specifies the Secure attribute of the cookie.

HttpOnly.description: Specifies whether a cookie is accessible by client-side script.

SameSite.description: Specifies the SameSite attribute of the cookie.

IsEssential.description: Specifies whether a cookie is essential for the application to function correctly. If true then consent policy checks may be bypassed.

Active.description: Active health checks are based on sending health probing requests.

Enabled.description: Determines if active health checks are enabled.

Interval.description: Period of sending health probing requests. Format: 'hh:mm:ss'.

Timeout.description: Period of waiting for a health check response. Format: 'hh:mm:ss'.

Query.description: Query string to append to the probe, including the leading '?'.

Passive.description: Passive health checks are based on observing the health of the responses from the destination.

Enabled.description: Determines if passive health checks are enabled.

ReactivationPeriod.description: Period after which an unhealthy destination reverts back to an Unknown health state. Format: 'hh:mm:ss'.

SslProtocols.description: Specifies the SSL protocols to use.

DangerousAcceptAnyServerCertificate.description: Determines whether the server's SSL certificate validity is checked by the client. Setting it to true completely disables validation.

MaxConnectionsPerServer.description: Specifies the maximum number of connections per server.

EnableMultipleHttp2Connections.description: Determines if multiple HTTP/2 connections are enabled.

RequestHeaderEncoding.description: Specifies the encoding of request headers, e.g. 'utf-8'.

ResponseHeaderEncoding.description: Specifies the encoding of response headers, e.g. 'utf-8'.

WebProxy.description: Config used to construct a System.Net.WebProxy instance used for outgoing requests.

Address.description: The URI of the proxy server.

BypassOnLocal.description: If true, bypasses the proxy for local addresses.

UseDefaultCredentials.description: If true, sends CredentialCache.DefaultCredentials with requests.

HttpRequest.description: Options controlling requests sent to destinations.

ActivityTimeout.description: Specifies how long a request is allowed to remain idle between any operation completing, after which it will be canceled. Format: 'hh:mm:ss'.

Version.description: Preferred version of the outgoing request.

VersionPolicy.description: The policy applied to version selection, e.g. whether to prefer downgrades, upgrades or request an exact version.

AllowResponseBuffering.description: Determines if response buffering is allowed.

Metadata.description: Arbitrary key-value pairs for custom cluster logic.
